Dear Mr. Holt:
This letter is a follow-up to the Department’s findings regarding the interim inspection
conducted at your facility on 04/28/2022. The purpose of this inspection was to determine
compliance with applicable licensing statutes and administrative rules for Court Operated
Residential Care Facility.
The violations that were found are:
R 400.10209 Resident report.
(1) A written resident report shall be completed 30 days
after admission and every 15 days thereafter for each
resident in a detention or shelter care facility.
Two of three active detention youth case files reviewed did not have the written
reports completed as required. This involved one initial report (6-days late) and
seven of nine 15-day updated reports (36, 27, 17, 17, 6, 1, and 1 days late,
respectively).
Due to the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/mdhhs  517-373-3740

 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
The Department provides technical assistance to meet the licensing requirements and
consultation to improve services.
Please contact me with any questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need
to speak to someone immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area
manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
5/2/22
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
5/2/22
Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager
